Key Match Events: Sikandar Raza and Sikandar Raza picked up three wickets each to defend the lowest total ever against India
Ravi Bishnoi's four wickets restricted Zimbabwe to 115/9
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill won the toss and opted to bowl first
The pitch looked on the drier side
Zimbabwe's captain, Sikandar Raza, said he doesn't mind batting first and trusts the transition phase of the team
Shubman Gill said the team let themselves down in the field and were not up to standard
Clive Madande said they needed to play a bit harder and smarter, showing talent but needing better results
Post-Match Reflections: Sikandar Raza, Zimbabwe's captain, felt happy about the win and stressed the importance of sticking to their plans
Shubman Gill expressed disappointment with the fielding and batting performance
Clive Madande praised the team's efforts but acknowledged the need for improvement
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Harare Sports Club
India needs 16 runs to win in the final over
Sundar tried to hoik a pull shot on the leg-side to get the top edge and Muzrambani took a calm catch under pressure to close things out for Zimbabwe
